options.name: Back
options.text: Exit the resources menu

options.name: Contact us
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to contact us, and we are always happy to help. For this particular concern, I think it would be best if you gave us a call at {phone} so we can speak with you directly. We are here {days}, {hours} answering calls if you have the time to do so.

options.name: What is your extension?
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out. We at the Helpdesk are always happy to provide technical assistance. We need to know what the extension is for that phone. If you can simply reply back to this email with that 4 digit extension, we can pursue a resolution for you.

If you have additional concerns, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.

options.name: Service Outage - [Service Name]
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to contact us, and we are always happy to help. We are aware at this time that {service} is experiencing service disruptions, and we ask for your patience as that vendor works to resolve the disruption. If you have concerns outside of this reported outage, feel free to give us a call, or reply back {days}, {hours}. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: Have you called?
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out. I'm just following up with you to see if you have been able to give us a call so that we can address your concerns? If you have not had time to call, replying to this email to let us know that you are still needing help would be your next best step. You can reach us at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.

options.name: General Troubleshooting
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things you can try when it comes to troubleshooting common hardware or driver related issues.

Attempt the following:

⚑ Search for 'Check for updates' in the lower left search bar on your taskbar

⚑ Once that menu opens up, select 'Check for updates'

⚑ After that process finishes, look for blue text that says 'View optional updates' on that same page. It is usually underneath the button to check for updates. If you do not know how to run the optional updates, check out this link:
https://pureinfotech.com/install-optional-updates-windows-10/ 

⚑ Allow those to finish, restart your computer, then attempt to use the hardware / software that you were initially trying to.

⚑ If you have a Kensington docking station at your desk, you may also want to power cycle that device as well, as that addresses many of the common display and audio issues staff members run into. To do this, locate the black cylindrical cable that is in the lowest possible port in the back panel. Unplug that cord, allow about 30 seconds to pass, plug the cord back in and see if that resolved your issue.

If you have concerns about these steps, or they did not work, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

options.name: Assign To TLP - [Room #]
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

->Make sure you send the TLP the ticket via TOPdesk. Their emails are in the resource below.
-> Note that student't do not need to know

options.name: Appointment Scheduling
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to us at the Helpdesk. Scheduling an appointment to pickup, swap, or drop off equipment is very easy to do, and you can do so by clicking this link:

{APlink}

or by completing the following steps:

⚑ Go to the Puyallup School District's website

⚑ Hover over the 'Staff' box on the upper right-hand side of the page

⚑ Click the Edtec Helpdesk link

⚑ Click 'Schedule an Appointment'

⚠ Please note that all of our school's libraries typically have staff and student devices on hand that you can either check out, or swap with your current device. Often times, you can avoid having to make a trip to come see us by first checking with your school's library.

If you have additional questions or concerns, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.

⚑  Address: 1501 39th Ave. SW. Puyallup, WA. 98373
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Teachers and students can perform device swaps at their school's libraries. 
-> Students MUST go to their schools for a device swap. They will not come to Edtec unless otherwise directed.
-> Make sure you record the ticket number in the calendar appointment if you're scheduling the appointment for a caller.
-> Leave a brief description of why this appointment was scheduled, so other techs know what to expect.

options.name: Instructional Coaches
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. This concern would be best addressed by one of our instructional coaches who specialize in the software you're referring to. I encourage you to take some time to email one of them to schedule an appointment over Teams, or in person. Here is the most up to date information for the coaches:

K-12 ELA (Reading, Writing) Gena Vincent and Jennifer Chavez
K-12 Social Studies: Leslie Snyder, Jeanna Kooser
K-12 Math: Priscilla Millan, Lizzie Herrera
K-12 Science: Ann Schumacher, Joshua Simondet
AP Matt White

GLAD/EL Tabitha Aragon
GLAD/CTE Jessica Anderson

New Teacher Induction/Mentoring: Sophia Monge, Candice McGregor
Technology: Jennifer Matthews, Jeremy Roy

Please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours} if you have additional questions. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> The coaches are great for setting up Teams meetings, OneNote Notebooks etc. 
-> Coaches provided one on one training for staff in classroom technology as well. 
-> Ask about current office hours!

options.name: Back
options.text: Exit the Quick Responses menu

options.name: Facilities
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact Facilities. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: Job applications
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact HR. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: Frontline
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact Kathy Barnett at ESC. Have an excellent rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> If this is simply for getting a user logged in, make sure the caller is on the correct page. There are a couple different sign in pages for Frontline.

options.name: IEP Online
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact Margaret Mason for IEP related concerns. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: SafeSchools
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact Megan Davis at ESC. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: Acadience
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

We appreciate you reaching out to the Helpdesk and we are always happy to help. However, this concern is not something that is handled by the Helpdesk, or Edtec as a whole. You will need to contact the Assessments Department. Have an excellent rest of your day!

options.name: Back
options.text: Exit the wrong department menu

options.name: Document Cameras
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things we can try with document cameras that resolve many of the common issues teachers run into. First, ensure the following are in good order:

⚑ Check the power cable at the wall, and camera levels. If either side of the cable is loose, that could cause a variety of problems

⚑ Make sure that the video cable (HDMI) is firmly seated in both the camera, and the other end of the cable. The HDMI cable must be in the 'HDMI out' port in the document camera

⚑ Note that when booting up, the power light on the camera will flash red for about 3 seconds. After that, press the power button once and the light should turn green

⚑ Check the status of the power light. If it is amber or orange, check the switch on the right-side of the body, and ensure the little black switch is set to 'RGB.'

If all these things look in order, and you are still having trouble using your document camera, we may need to send out a building technician to your room. You're more than welcome to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours} to address this further. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Questions to consider
---------------------

-> What is the model number? Ex. F70W
-> What color is the light above the power button?
	-> Green means good to go
	-> Amber means check RGB Switch
	-> Red means the camera is off
	-> Flashing red means the camera is booting up
-> Have you checked to make sure the HDMI cable is plugged into the HDMI Out port on the camera?
-> Is the little black switch set to RGB?
-> When did you notice it stopped working?
-> Have you cycled through the available HDMI options on the TV?
-> Has anything changed about your setup that you are aware of?
-> Consider escalating to a Building Tech if none of these resolved the concern

options.name: ActionTecs
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things you can try when it comes to troubleshooting Actiontecs (Black starfish on the wall above, beside, or behind your classroom television).

Attempt the following:

⚑ Disconnect from the Actiontec on your computer if you are connected to it

⚑ Locate the Actiontec and unplug the power cable for several seconds

⚑ Plug the power cable back in and wait for the blue LED light to shine

⚑ Go back to your computer and attempt to connect to it

⚑ If prompted for a code input: 12345670

⚑ If you still can't connect, or you can't see your device, attempt to run all of the required and optional updates, then restart it. If you do not know how to run the optional updates, check out this link:
https://pureinfotech.com/install-optional-updates-windows-10/ 

⚑ If you can now connect, but can't see an image on the TV, you may need to ensure you are on the correct HDMI input

⚑ If all that checks out, ensure the 'Display Settings' on your computer are what you expect. Often times staff intend to 'Duplicate' a display, but the setting is instead set to 'Extend. Here is a detailed guide that covers the ins and outs of configuring your display settings:
https://www.amd.com/en/support/kb/faq/dh-009 

If you have any concerns about these steps, or they did not work, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Questions to consider
---------------------

-> Do you see a blue light coming out of the black starfish? (Has power if so)
-> Do you know where to go to connect to a wireless display?
	-> Search for 'Connect to a wireless display' in the task bar's search function
	-> Scroll to the bottom of the page and select 'Connect to a wireless display'
	-> Select the room number's Actiontec
	-> Enter 12345670 if prompted to
-> Have you checked to ensure your display settings are what you expect?
-> Have you power-cycled the Actiontec, forgotten it on your device, then reversed the process?
-> When did you notice it stopped working?
-> Have you cycled through the available HDMI options on the TV?
-> Has anything changed about your setup that you are aware of?
-> Consider escalating to a Building Tech if none of these resolved the concern

options.name: NewLine
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things to consider when it comes to troubleshooting your classroom television.

Attempt the following:

⚑ First, look at the home screen of your TV and take note of the right-hand side. If there is a valid input signal, you will see one of the 'HDMI' boxes illuminated. This is great if you do! It means that your Actiontec (Black starfish on the wall above, beside, or behind your classroom television) is connected to the TV, and the TV is able to talk to it. That is the input you want your TV to be set to

⚑ If you are in a newer elementary school, locate the black box on the left-hand side of your television to switch between those HDMI options if you need to. Otherwise, you can use the touchscreen function to switch between the HDMI inputs if necessary

⚑ If everything looks good with the HDMI input, then your issue likely rests with your Actiontec

If you need more information, or you think your Actiontec is to blame, please feel free to respond back to this ticket for more information, or give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

Here is the user manual if you would like to dive deeper into a specific topic: https://newline-interactive.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/TRUTOUCH-VN_User-Manual.pdf
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> More often then not, Newline concerns are actually Actiontec concerns. See that menu item for more details
-> Staff frequently forget that there is a little black box on the back of the TV that allows them to cycle the HDMI input options. Use that if necessary
-> Every so often, staff want to use the whiteboard functionality - this is in the user manual
-> Note that when the TV detects input on an HDMI option, the option will appear solid white on the screen

options.name: Juno Speakers
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things we can try with the Juno speakers that resolve many of the common issues teachers run into. Here are some 'if then' steps to follow. If any of these apply, give the solution a try!

⚑ IF the tower will not wake up from standby mode, THEN: raise the volume and make sure the microphone is on (if you have one) and working correctly

⚑ IF there is no sound coming out of the Juno, THEN: raise the volume, ensure that you have the correct audio output on your computer. You can do this by clicking the little speaker symbol on the lower right-hand side of your taskbar, then selecting the correct output. You will also want to check the audio cable that links your Juno to the Actiontec in your classroom, if you have one.

⚑ IF you turn the tower on and only get a white screen, THEN: power off the tower, wait a full and complete minute, then turn the tower back on

⚑ IF the display will not turn on at all, THEN: verify that the power supply is plugged into both the receiver, and a working wall outlet. You will also want to check the power switch on the device to ensure it is on. Lastly, if you have an additional power supply around, try that one to rule out supply issues

⚑ IF you are hearing a squealing sound or feedback, THEN: lower the microphone volume controls on the tower. You may also need to position the mic closer to your mouth. Finally, go to your Juno's settings and ensure that the 'Music Audio In' options is not checked. You can find that option in the 'Microphone Volume Screen.' 

If none of these apply to you, or the steps did not address your concern, then we may need to send out your building technician. You're more than welcome to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours} if you have additional questions. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Juno issues often get forwarded to the building tech
-> If there is just no sound, check the HDMI out option on their device. It needs to be on 'Digital Out'
-> Paste the response for this one and go through the IF THEN steps
-> Don't forget to get a room number if you escalate!

options.name: SMART Board
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things we can consider with the SMART Board that tend to resolve many of the common issues teachers run into. Here are some 'if then' statements to go through. If any of these apply, give the solution a try!

⚑ IF the Ready light (an LED located on the lower-right corner of the frame) is off, THEN: there is no power going to the SMART Board and you'll need to check the power source

⚑ IF the Ready light is solid green, THEN: the SMART Board is successfully communicating with the SMART software on the connected computer

⚑ IF the Ready light is flashing green, THEN: the SMART Board is successfully communicating with the computer's USB port, but either the SMART Board software is not installed, or the SMART Board service is not running.

⚠ Note that In this mode, the SMART Board operates as a touch screen. The SMART Board tools, such as the pens and eraser, won’t work, but you can move the mouse pointer and perform mouse functions by touching anywhere on the screen. This mode may be desirable for occasional or guest users who don’t require the use of SMART Board tools or pen tray functions.

⚑ IF the Ready light is solid red, THEN: the SMART Board has power but it is not communicating with the computer. In this case, first check that the connection is solid and there are no breaks or kinks in the cable. Second, unplug the SMART Board's USB connection form the computer, uninstall the SMART Software, restart your computer, then re-install the SMART software. Next, plug in the SMART Board, run the 'Connection Wizard', then run the 'System Tray tools.' If all goes well, you should see that solid green light, and the touchscreen should accept input.

If none of these steps address your concern, then we may need to send out your building technician. You're more than welcome to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours} if you have additional questions. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> IF the Ready light (an LED located on the lower-right corner of the frame) is off, THEN: there is no power going to the SMART Board and you'll need to check the power source
-> IF the Ready light is solid green, THEN: the SMART Board is successfully communicating with the SMART software on the connected computer
-> IF the Ready light is flashing green, THEN: the SMART Board is successfully communicating with the computer's USB port, but either the SMART Board software is not installed, or the SMART Board service is not running.
	-> Note that In this mode, the SMART Board operates as a touch screen. The SMART Board tools, such as the pens and eraser, won’t work, but you can move the mouse pointer and perform mouse functions by touching anywhere on the screen.
	-> This mode may be desirable for occasional or guest users who don’t require the use of SMART Board tools or pen tray functions.
-> IF the Ready light is solid red, THEN: the SMART Board has power but it is not communicating with the computer.
	-> In this case, first check that the connection is solid and there are no breaks or kinks in the cable.
	-> Second, unplug the SMART Board's USB connection form the computer, uninstall the SMART Software, restart your computer, then re-install the SMART software.
	-> Next, plug in the SMART Board, run the 'Connection Wizard', then run the 'System Tray tools.' If all goes well, you should see that solid green light, and the touchscreen should accept input.

options.name: Voicemail Forwarding
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out. We at the Helpdesk are always happy to provide technical assistance. When it comes to voicemail forwarding, you can try the following steps to prevent it:

⚑ Pickup the handset and dial #2

⚑ Listen for the beep, then hang up

⚑ Pickup the handset and dial #3

⚑ Listen for the beep, then hang up

That is all you need to do! If this did not work, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Pickup the handset and dial #2
-> Listen for the beep, then hang up
-> Pickup the handset and dial #3
-> Listen for the beep, then hang up

options.name: Projectors
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. There are a few things we can try with projectors that resolve many of the common issues teachers run into. First, ensure the following is in good order:

⚑ Check the power cable at the wall and ensure that it is firmly seated in the outlet. If the cable is loose, that could cause a variety of problems

⚑ Make sure that the video cable is firmly seated and the input option is set to the correct input

⚑ If the picture quality is dark, adjust 'BRIGHT' and 'CONTRAST' settings and turn off the 'WHISPER' mode in the settings. This may also be an indication of a failing bulb

⚑ If the picture appears blurry, adjust the 'FOCUS' and the 'PHASE settings 

The following cases indicate that we need to send out your building technician

⚑ Blinking red light over the 'LAMP' indicator - This usually indicates a dirty filter, or a damaged bulb. It could also indicate that the cooling fan has failed, the lamp cover is not properly fixed, or overheating has occurred

⚑ If the green 'POWER', red 'LAMP' and red 'TEMP' lights are blinking, that indicates it is time for the filter to be replaced.

If you have tried to adjust the settings mentioned above with no progress, or have observed any of these light sequences, we must send a technician to your room. You're more than welcome to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours} if you have additional concerns. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Questions & Considerations
---------------------

-> If the picture quality is dark, adjust 'BRIGHT' and 'CONTRAST' settings and turn off the 'WHISPER' mode in the settings.
	-> This may also be an indication of a failing bulb
-> If the picture appears blurry, adjust the 'FOCUS' and the 'PHASE settings 
-> Send out a tech if:
	-> Blinking red light over the 'LAMP' indicator - This usually indicates a dirty filter, or a damaged bulb. It could also indicate that the cooling fan has failed, the lamp cover is not properly fixed, or overheating has occurred
	-> If the green 'POWER', red 'LAMP' and red 'TEMP' lights are blinking, that indicates it is time for the filter to be replaced.

options.name: Device Internet Issues
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Often times, troubleshooting a device's connectivity  is simple and only requires the following:

⚑ Locate the power button on the device

⚑ Hold down that button until the screen goes completely black, then let go

⚑ Wait about 30 seconds, then press the button one time 

⚑ After a few moments, you should see the boot screen that eventually brings you to the login screen

⚑ Log in and check your internet status. If you are not sure how to do this, click on the link below:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/connect-to-a-wi-fi-network-in-windows-10-1f881677-b569-0cd5-010d-e3cd3579d263 

⚠ Note that you may need to repeat the previous steps up to three separate times to have a stable wireless connection.

Here are some bonus resources that may answer questions you, or others might have:

⚑ Turning airplane mode on or off
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/turn-airplane-mode-on-or-off-f2c2e0a1-706f-ff26-c4b2-4a37f9796df1 

⚑ Microsoft troubleshooting tips
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/sbs/topic/can't-connect-to-internet-a85b5012-804f-517a-b548-f2f9274e3563?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US

If you need additional help troubleshooting your connectivity, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Most of these issues are resolved by power cycling the device up to three separate times
-> Approve for a swap if they aren't able to get a hard-lined connection
-> If they can, get them hard-lined in, remote in and install the optional updates / check drivers & reboot
-> You may also want to 'Sync' the Company Portal to bring down any wireless profiles the device could be missing.
	-> See 'How to sync the Company Portal' in the General Software Concerns Menu

links.label: How to connect to a network

options.name: Back
options.text: Exit the hardware concerns

options.name: Suspicious Emails
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. We appreciate you taking the time to contact us and we are always happy to help. When it comes to suspicious emails, there is no need to call or email us as Outlook has an excellent tool that does that on your behalf.

If you simply select 'Report Message' from the upper right-hand side of the application window, you can then select 'Phishing' and that will both remove the email from your inbox, then report that message to Microsoft and our security team. If you have questions or concerns, you are more than welcome to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.

⚠ If you have interacted with a suspicious email and provided any district login information, please change your password immediately by doing the following:

⚑ Hit CTRL + ALT + DEL on your keyboard

⚑ Select 'Change a password'

⚑ Follow the prompts to change your password

⚑ Log out of your computer, then log back in with the new password
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> See the link on how to report a message in Outlook. That's all they have to do.

links.label: How to report a message in Outlook

options.name: Connecting to PSDSTAFF on Android
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for contacting the Helpdesk. We enjoy working to resolve technical problems for our staff, students and families. Connecting to the staff WIFI is a common question and it may be a little more involved than people realize. Here are the steps you can take to connect to PSDSTAFF:

⚑ Select the PSDSTAFF network

⚑ Ensure that the EAP setting is set to PEAP

⚑ Input your district credentials and ensure you only put in the segment before the @ sign. Note that this is case sensitive.

⚑ Under certificates, ensure that you select 'Do Not Validate'

⚑ Under advanced, look for an option that says 'Phase 2 Authenticate' then for that, input MSCHP V2

After all that, you should be able to connect to the PSDSTAFF wireless network. If you have any questions about this, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> See the link on what settings to input

options.name: Resetting Passwords
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. We would be happy to work with you to reset your password, however, we have policies in place to protect our staff and students. In order for us to reset your password, you will have to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.

This is so that we can verify your identity, ask some security questions and ensure that your account stays as secure as possible. Thanks for understanding, and we look forward to assisting you soon.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> For students:
	-> Make sure that you verify their student ID (Lunch Number)
	-> Ask them to verify a teachers name on their schedule - check eSchools
	-> Ask them to verify their birth date
	-> Use the 'Password Reset Tool' which can be downloaded from Company Portal
-> For staff:
	-> Verify their employee ID number
	-> If they don't know it, get last 4 of social and verify in Business Plus

options.name: Student Login Concerns
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Student logins can be a little confusing, as there are often numerous students with the same names that then require numbers after their last names in their email addresses. However, for most students, the format is as follows:

⚑ Username / Email: firstname.lastname@students.puyallupsd.org

⚠ Note that for students with a hyphenated last name, simply remove the hyphen and merge the two names into one lowercase word

⚑ Password: [first initial][last initial][2 digit birth month][2 digit birth day] note that this is all lower case, and the password for K-6 now includes the last 4 digits of the primary phone number on file.

If you need additional help logging a student in, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Most often, the student / TLP is using the wrong phone number in their password.
	-> They must use eSchools to get the number and it is the first listed guardian's HOME PHONE number.
-> If a TLP is calling and they are using Destiny, they are wrong

options.name: Trusted Platform Module Error
options.text: No common response for this error - It's tricky to identify sometimes
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Reboot, reboot, reboot
-> Try clearing credentials if that does not work
-> If it persists, approve them for a swap

options.name: Outlook Emails Not Sending
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Below is a link to a great resource that addresses this concern. The benefit of going to this page is the clear documentation, pictures and helpful links. Note that we at the Helpdesk are not experts when it comes to the ins and outs of Outlook, so I encourage you to take some time and review this resource.

If after looking through this support page (and referenced pages), you are not able to find information about your specific concern, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

⚑ Link:
 https://kb.intermedia.net/article/1187 

Here are some bonus resources that may address other Outlook concerns that you, or other staff members may have:

⚑ Setting up custom views:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-change-or-customize-a-view-f693f3d9-0037-4fa0-9376-3a57b6337b71 

⚑ Scheduling Teams meetings in Outlook:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/schedule-a-teams-meeting-from-outlook-883cc15c-580f-441a-92ea-0992c00a9b0f 

⚑ Setting up signatures:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-and-add-a-signature-to-messages-8ee5d4f4-68fd-464a-a1c1-0e1c80bb27f2
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Check out the linked resource below. I'd try enabling and disabling cached mode
-> You may also want to do an Office repair

options.name: Adding A Shared Mailbox
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Below is a link to a great resource that addresses this concern. The benefit of going to this page is the clear documentation, pictures and helpful links. Note that we at the Helpdesk are not experts when it comes to the ins and outs of Outlook, so I encourage you to take some time and review this resource.

If after looking through this support page (and referenced pages), you are not able to find information about your specific concern, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

⚑ Link:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/open-and-use-a-shared-mailbox-in-outlook-d94a8e9e-21f1-4240-808b-de9c9c088afd 

Here are some bonus resources that may address other Outlook concerns that you, or other staff members may have:

⚑ Setting up custom views:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-change-or-customize-a-view-f693f3d9-0037-4fa0-9376-3a57b6337b71 

⚑ Scheduling Teams meetings in Outlook:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/schedule-a-teams-meeting-from-outlook-883cc15c-580f-441a-92ea-0992c00a9b0f 

⚑ Setting up signatures:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-and-add-a-signature-to-messages-8ee5d4f4-68fd-464a-a1c1-0e1c80bb27f2
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> This is a rather uncommon request, but the first linked resource is helpful.
-> Check out the other resources for help with signatures, Teams and Outlook etc..

links.label: How to open and use a shared mailbox

options.name: Outlook Calendar
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Below is a link to Microsoft's Support Page which covers a variety of Calendar related concerns. The benefit of going to this page is the clear documentation, pictures and helpful links. Note that we at the Helpdesk are not experts when it comes to the ins and outs of calendars, so I encourage you to take some time and review this resource.

If after looking through this support page (and referenced pages), you are not able to find information about your specific calendar concern, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

⚑ Link:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/introduction-to-the-outlook-calendar-d94c5203-77c7-48ec-90a5-2e2bc10bd6f8 

Here are some bonus resources that may address other Outlook concerns that you, or other staff members may have:

⚑ Setting up custom views:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-change-or-customize-a-view-f693f3d9-0037-4fa0-9376-3a57b6337b71 

⚑ Scheduling Teams meetings in Outlook:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/schedule-a-teams-meeting-from-outlook-883cc15c-580f-441a-92ea-0992c00a9b0f 

⚑ Setting up signatures:
 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-and-add-a-signature-to-messages-8ee5d4f4-68fd-464a-a1c1-0e1c80bb27f2
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Outlook calendars can be tricky and sometimes result in escalation to our Sys. Eng. Team.
-> The resource gives a good into on the calendar

options.name: Adobe Creative Cloud
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Signing into Adobe Creative Cloud is the only way that staff and students can get licenses for Adobe products in our district. If you did not sign into Adobe Creative Cloud with your district credentials, you will likely be warned that your account is about to expire or you may be prompted to pay for the service. To use Adobe products, such as Acrobat, Illustrator or Photoshop the correct way, complete the following: 

⚑ Search for 'Adobe Creative Cloud' on your computer

⚑ Sign into that service with your district credentials

⚑ Allow sufficient time for that application to get setup on your device, then open the application of interest from that portal 

If you need additional help getting an Adobe licensing issue resolved, please give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Staff members have to sign into Adobe Creative cloud in order to gain licenses to use the software. If they have never signed in, they will be put on a 14 day trial.
-> If they have signed in and are still not able to use Adobe apps, check with the MME team.
-> Uninstalling Adobe apps, then reinstalling them through Creative Cloud usually resolves most issues

options.name: PSDVPN
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. When it comes to the PSDVPN, there are a couple things to consider. One, you do not need to be connected to the VPN if you are at a school and on one of our networks. Second, the VPN does connect you to TAC, eSchools, BusinessPlus etc. - but only when you are outside of a district building. If you are having issues connecting to the VPN or are seeing error codes, please do give us a call so we can troubleshoot for you. If you are having trouble finding the VPN complete the following:

⚑ Move your mouse curser down to the right-hand side of the taskbar (The large rectangle on the bottom of the screen). 

⚑ Look for either three curves, or a little computer with a plug next to it

⚑ Click that and at the top of that menu, look for PSDVPN

⚑ Click the PSDVPN, then select 'Connect'

If you have completed the above steps, and are not seeing the PSDVPN complete the next few steps:

⚑ Search for your 'Company Portal' by typing to search on the left-hand side of your taskbar

⚑ Open the Company Portal and allow a few moments to load

⚑ Look for a little gear icon on the lower left-hand side of the window and click that

⚑ At the top of the window, look for the 'Sync' button and click that

⚑ Allow up to an hour for this to complete then restart your computer

⚑ Once logged in, go back to the first set of instructions and look for your VPN.

If after completing all of these steps, you still do not see the VPN or are not able to connect to it, please give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. You can also reply back to this ticket to continue working with us. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Disconnect from the VPN if the staff member is in a district building
-> Staff members must connect to the VPN in order to use TAC / eSchools / BusinessPlus from home
-> Sometimes a connection must be forced if a user can't connect the typical way.
	-> Navigate over to: '%AppData%/Microsoft/Network/Connections/pbk' and run the 'rasphone.pbk' file. Follow the prompts and this force a connection
-> Still can't connect, escalate to Sys. Eng. Team

options.name: Display Settings
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Below is a link to a page which covers the ins and outs of configuring your display settings. The benefit of going to this page is the clear documentation and annotated pictures. I encourage you to take some time and review this resource prior to calling as this may answer your question more quickly than we can on busy days.

If after looking through this support page, you are not able to find information about your specific display settings concern, please feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!

⚑ Link:
https://www.amd.com/en/support/kb/faq/dh-009
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> This is one of those things that just takes some patience and targeted questions. Ask them how they want things to look, and do your best to represent that in the settings.
-> The resource helps explain this if you're unfamiliar

options.name: Adding folder from SharePoint to File Explorer
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to us at the Helpdesk. Fortunately, adding folders from SharePoint to your File Explorer is very easy. Below is a visual guide that will take will walk you through how to do this.

⚑ Link:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/view-and-open-sharepoint-files-with-file-explorer-66b574bb-08b4-46b6-a6a0-435fd98194cc 

If you would rather not review the documentation, you can complete the following steps:

⚑ First, open an internet browser (Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome)

⚑ Navigate over to your SharePoint of interest

⚑ Find the folder that you want to add to your File Explorer

⚑ Select the folder and look for the option to 'Sync' on the upper right-hand side of the page

⚑ Click that option and allow OneDrive to complete this function

⚑ Done! The folder will now be available in your File Explorer.

If you have any questions about these steps, or the resource, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> All you have to do is navigate over to the SharePoint directory they want to add, click on 'Sync' and it will appear in their File Explorer

links.label: How to Sync to File Explorer

options.name: Printing issues
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Connecting to our printers can be challenging at times and there are a few things you need to check prior to a successful print. First, ensure that your PSDVPN is disconnected, and the box to connect automatically is unchecked. Second, ensure that you are on the PSDWIRELESS network or your connection shows psd.local. Lastly, ensure that you have added this printer through Printix. If these things are in order and you still can't print, follow the next steps:

⚑ Open your Company Portal

⚑ Search for 'Printix Service Fix' and install it

⚑ Attempt to print to the printer

⚑ If that is not successful, try removing the printer in your 'Printers & Scanners' menu, then re-add the printer through Printix.

If adding a printer through Printix is something you are not sure about, complete the following steps

⚑ Move your mouse cursor down to the lower right-hand side of your taskbar (The long rectangle on the bottom of your screen)

⚑ Look for an upwards facing arrow ∧ and click that to open a small menu

⚑ Search for a little black and white 'P' and click that to open another menu

⚑ Search for the top menu option that says 'Printers' and click that to open another menu

⚑ In this menu, search for the printer you want to add, select the checkbox next to it, then click 'add' on the lower right-hand side of that menu

Please feel free to give us a call if you have additional questions at {phone}, {days}, {hours}. Have a wonderful rest of your day!
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> First check to make sure they are on PSDWIRELESS or PSDDEVICES
-> Check to make sure the PSDVPN is disconnected and the box to 'Connect Automatically' is unchecked
-> Ensure they have signed into Printix and have added the printers they want to use
-> Make sure the printer doesn't require a user code provided by the Office Manager
-> Check the Printix service and make sure it's running (Usually obvious by no printers showing up in the Printix list) - restart with admin creds if necessary
-> Escalate to Sys. Eng. Team if all these things are in place, but they still can't print

links.label: How to put in a user code

options.name: Employee Online Login
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Thankfully, logging into Employee Online is pretty straight forward if you know where to go and your staff credentials:

⚑ Username / Email: Everything before the @ sign in your staff email

⚑ Password: The same password you use to log into a staff device. If you have never reset this password it will follow this format - E000000Welcome! where the 0's are your employee ID. If you do not know your employee ID number, HR can provide that information to you by calling 253-841-1301.

⚑ Link to Employee Online
https://employeeonline.puyallup.k12.wa.us/ifas7/login/login.aspx?ReturnUrl=%2fbusinessplus%2femployeeonline%2fEOHomePage 

If you need additional help logging in, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Users can't log in usually because they are trying to use their entire email address. It's just the portion before the @ symbol.
-> They are usually in the wrong place as well. Note that the password is their Single Sign On (SSO) password.
-> If they are doing everything correctly, take a screenshot and escalate over to Business Apps

options.name: Parent Securly Concerns
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. Securly is a very powerful tool that we use throughout the district, and it does a great job of keeping out inappropriate content. However it can be an inconvenience when something gets blocked that was previously accessible. Securly undergoes frequent updates that add websites, or web applications to its blocked list.

As such, if you are seeing the Securly page when trying to access a resource, that web page has likely been added to that list. Note that as a parent, you also have access to the Securly Home App which gives you granular control of your student's device. You can disable applications, block websites and control screen time all from your smart phone.

If you would like to know more about this, feel free to navigate to the link below! You are also more than welcome to reach out to Securly support by emailing: support@securly.com if you have specific questions about the service. If you need anything else, or have other questions, feel free to reach out to us at {phone}, {days}, {hours}

⚑ Link:
https://homesupport.securly.com/hc/en-us/categories/360000431333-Securly-Home-App
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> If a parent is calling in because they can;t keep their student off of a website, you can escalate over to MME.
-> If the concern involves pornography or inappropriate content, escalate over to Security and refer to the attached resource

options.name: How To Install An Application
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. All of our devices should have an application installed by default named Company Portal. Company Portal is like the app store on your phone and it has all of the applications that you are allowed to download available. Here is a short step by step guide on how to get to Company Portal and download an app:

⚑ Click your Start Menu, or use the 'Search' function on the lower left-hand side of your Start Menu, and search for 'Company Portal'

⚑ Once you launch Company Portal, you will see a search function on the upper left-hand side of the window that looks like a magnifying glass

⚑ Click that, and search for whatever it is you're trying to download. If you do not see an application that you are looking for one of two things are happening. One, your account does not have access to that application, and you can make a follow up request to be granted that access. Or two, your Company Portal is out of date and you need to preform a 'Sync' 

⚑ To preform a Sync, click on the little gear icon on the lower left-hand side of the Company Portal window

⚑ That will bring you to a separate page which has a 'Sync' button at the top of it. Click that and allow up to 30 minutes for it to complete 

⚠ Note that you CAN NOT download applications from the internet on any of our managed devices. If you wish to download and install something that is not in Company Portal, you must submit a follow up request for consideration. 

If you have additional questions about downloading applications, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> The primary thing to consider here is that this is generally not possible outside of Company Portal.
-> If a Curriculum Director is calling in wanting to request a new program, there is a process in place. Refer to the P&P or confer with MME.

options.name: How To Install Office 365
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. All of our staff and students have access to the full Office Suite and you can download it by doing the following on a personal device (not owned by the district):

⚑ Navigate to 'portal.office.com' in any internet browser

⚑ Once there, login with your district credentials then draw your attention to the upper right-hand side of the screen

⚑ There, you should see a button to 'Install Office.' Click that to begin the installation

Alternatively, on a district issued device, you can 'Sync' your Company Portal to bring down the required Office applications. To do so, follow the remaining steps:

⚑ Locate the Company Portal application on your device. You can search for it with the 'Search Bar' down on the lower-left-hand side of your taskbar

⚑ To preform a Sync, click on the little gear icon on the lower left-hand side of the Company Portal window

⚑ That will bring you to a separate page which has a 'Sync' button at the top of it. Click that and allow up to 30 minutes for it to complete 

⚠ Note that you CAN NOT download applications from the internet on any of our managed devices. If you wish to download and install something that is not in Company Portal, with the exception of Microsoft Office, you must submit a follow up request for consideration. 

If you have additional questions about downloading applications, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Office can be installed on home computers and the process is easy
	-> Navigate to 'portal.office.com' in any internet browser
	-> login with your district credentials then draw your attention to the upper right-hand side of the screen
	-> There, you should see a button to 'Install Office.' Click that to begin the installation

options.name: How to Sync the Company Portal
options.text:
Good {time} {fname},

Thank you for reaching out to the Helpdesk. All of our devices should have an application installed by default named Company Portal. Company Portal is like the app store on your phone and it has all of the applications that you are allowed to download available. It also contains a tool that allows your device to check in with our systems and correct some common issues, such as the one you are experiencing. Here is a short step by step guide on how to get to Company Portal and perform a 'Sync':

⚑ Click your Start Menu, or use the 'Search' function on the lower left-hand side of your Start Menu, and search for 'Company Portal'

⚑ To preform a Sync, click on the little gear icon on the lower left-hand side of the Company Portal window

⚑ That will bring you to a separate page which has a 'Sync' button at the top of it which you can click to begin the process 

⚠ Note that you should allow up to 45 minutes for this process to complete, then restart your device after it does.

If you have additional questions about this process, or it was unsuccessful, feel free to give us a call at {phone}, {days}, {hours}.
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Company Portal is where staff and students get access to their applications. It's also where 'Syncs' occur which is when a device checks in with our Intune Management System
-> To 'Sync', open Company Portal, go to the settings page which is the little gear on the lower left-hand side
-> Select 'Sync' at the top of the page and allow around 30 minutes for it to complete

options.name: Back
options.text: Exit the common issues menu

options.name: eTrition
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> eTrition sometimes requires admin creds to open which can be input over TeamViewer 
-> If the app is not working as expected, try and uninstall it then re-install it
-> If that doesn't resolve it - escalate over to EdApps

options.name: TransFinder / RouteFinder
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Escalate over to EdApps - we don't do anything with this.

options.name: eSchoolPLUS / TAC / HAC
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> eSchools:
	-> There is a lot of information here and it's the source of everything in the district in terms of data
	-> Here, you can reset HAC passwords for parents, check student schedules, find ID numbers, emails etc..
	-> We do not do any troubleshooting however with eSchools with the exception of ensuring the VPN is on or off depending on if they are at home or work. Escalate to EdApps
TAC:
	-> TAC is where teachers take attendance and perform teacher specific duties
	-> We don't do anything with this either. Escalate to EdApps
HAC:
	-> All we can do here is reset passwords for parent logins which is done in eSchools

options.name: Typing Agent
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Just escalate to EdApps

options.name: Destiny
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> If someone is missing - just escalate to EdApps
-> Otherwise, some light training is something we can do

options.name: Schoology
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Here we can find Schoology access codes, reset passwords for parent logins and other troubleshooting.
-> Note that the search function in Schoology is very finicky and searching by first name, email or student ID only, tends to produce the best results.
-> You can also authorize OneDrive under 'Resources' in Schoology for assignment submission if necessary
-> The links detail the common things we have to do

links.label: How to find parent access code
How to register for a parent account

options.name: OpenText
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Escalate over to EdApps - we don't do anything with this.

options.name: Cognos
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Escalate over to EdApps - we don't do anything with this.

options.name: Quaver
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Escalate over to EdApps - we don't do anything with this.

options.name: Renaissance / AR / STAR
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Escalate over to EdApps - we don't do anything with this.

options.name: Clever
options.questions:
Things to consider
---------------------

-> Note that Clever is how students should be accessing Schoology and all of the other curriculum programs in the district, with few exceptions 
-> The only thing we really do with Clever is ensure that students can log into it. There is no troubleshooting beyond that. Escalate over to EdApps.

options.name: Back

options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: Securly
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: CTE Hardware / Software
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps - Kylie tends to oversee this app**

options.name: DAS program

options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: iPads / Apple products
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: Company Portal

options.name: Advanced Outlook concerns
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: Recurring OneDrive issues
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.questions: **Most things will be escalated to EdApps**

options.name: Resetting voicemail passwords
options.questions: Make sure you check the extension in HelpOne before you escalate it over to Network. The link is below!

options.name: Handheld radio concerns
options.questions: **Escalate to Network - We do nothing with this**

options.name: Any phone concerns
options.questions: Make sure you grab the extension before you escalate the concern. Grab the WHO, WHAT, WHERE as well and put it all in the ticket.

options.name: Wireless / wired network issues
options.questions:
Questions to consider
---------------------

-> Where are you?
-> Can you get onto any internet resources? Or is everything inaccessible?
-> When did you notice the network issues?
-> Have you tried to reboot your device?
-> Which network are you connected to? (PSDWIRELESS, PSDDEVICES etc.)
-> Try and remote in and identify anything obviously out of place.
	-> Note that if you can remote in, they do have internet.

options.name: Email access requests
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: Adding a printer to Printix
options.questions: **Escalate to EdApps**

options.name: Back

options.name: Exit
options.text: Exit the program
